title: Data Scientist, Optimization
description:
Our Mission

Move people.

Our Values

We are independent. Creative. Gutsy. We aren’t afraid to dream big. We are accountable. To our customers. To our cities. To each other. We are humble. Human. Lighthearted. We take our work seriously, but not ourselves.

Mobility is the lifeblood of urban environments and cities need affordable, emissions-free transportation options that are free of delays. We believe that shared electric mopeds will become an integral part of transit networks, filling gaps not served by bike share, car share, scooter share, or public transit.

About the role

We’re looking for a senior team member who can quickly and easily learn their way around a variety of data structures and technology and operate independently. With access to warehouses of real-time geospatial data as well as business operations data, this role will work closely with the Engineering team and the rest of the Data Science team to propose and develop solutions to power key aspects of our applications. You will report to the Director, Data Science and Analytics.
Technical Requirements
5-7 years experience working as a data scientist, some of which spent in transportation-related endeavors
Background in areas such as Industrial Engineering, Operations Research, Logistics is a plus
An applied understanding of machine learning and optimization methods, including geospatial techniques for route optimization
Experience working with large data sets and building scalable, production-ready models with near real-time response times
Strong knowledge of Python, SQL (particularly Postgres and PostGIS), and R
Familiarity with AWS services such as Kinesis, S3, EC2, RDS, and Redshift
Ability to quickly understand new technologies and data environments
Non-technical Requirements
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Ability to summarize key findings into clear and actionable recommendations, and to interact with individuals at all levels
Strong project management skills and ability to plan and prioritize work in a fast-paced environment
Sense of urgency and an ability to multitask
Some management experience preferred
Team player and willing to pick up extra responsibilities as required
You are enthusiastic, reliable, and hardworking
Responsibilities
Develop a thorough understanding of the business, from the user perspective and multiple operations perspectives
Build a complete knowledge of relevant internal and external data repositories
Own optimization initiatives such as: 1) Build optimal routes for battery swappers and mechanics considering a variety of dynamic factors and 2) allocate tasks to operators taking into account the varying cost/benefit to the entire system
Partner with the engineering team to implement models in a scalable, real-time, production environment, functioning across multiple locations
